The use of the House of Europe Consulting website is generally possible without providing personal data. However, if a user wishes to use special services through our website, processing of personal data may be necessary. If the processing of personal data is required and there is no legal basis for such processing, we generally obtain the consent of the user.

about.title: Who is Washington de Sousa?
about.description: Brazilian, entrepreneur, consultant, and professional mentor who has been living in Germany for over 11 years. My professional background includes extensive experience in international business, specialized recruitment, digital marketing, and strategic business development.
about.experience: I started my professional career at EMBRAER and have gained expertise in various technical and commercial areas over the years. In Europe, I deepened my academic knowledge at IU â€“ International University of Applied Sciences in Digital Business, developed successful businesses, and closed strategic contracts that underscore my solid experience and performance capabilities.
about.approach: My approach is personal, pragmatic, and human. I take pride in accompanying Brazilian companies and professionals on their path to success in Europe, offering a unique combination of experience, technical knowledge, strategic network, and deep understanding of local cultures and market dynamics.
about.social: Beyond consulting, I dedicate myself to social and educational projects as founder and president of Metanoia Ministry e.V., reflecting my commitment to personal development, education, and community support.

hero.title: Privacy Policy
hero.subtitle: How we protect your data
hero.description: Understand how we collect, use and protect your personal information

sections.title: Privacy
sections.content: Data privacy has a particularly high priority for the management of House of Europe Consulting. The use of the House of Europe Consulting website is generally possible without providing personal data. However, if a user wishes to use special services through our website, processing of personal data may be necessary. If the processing of personal data is necessary and there is no legal basis for such processing, we generally obtain the user's consent.

sections.title: 1. Definitions
sections.content: The privacy policy of House of Europe Consulting is based on the terms used by the European legislator when adopting the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Our privacy policy should be easy to read and understand for the general public as well as for our customers and business partners.

sections.title: 2. Name and Address of the Controller
sections.content:
Controller for the purposes of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is:

House of Europe Consulting
Owner: Washington L. De-Sousa
Cologne - Germany
Email: info@houseofeuropeconsulting.de
Website: www.houseofeuropeconsulting.de

sections.title: 3. Collection of General Data and Information
sections.content: The House of Europe Consulting website collects a series of general data and information when a user or automated system accesses the website. This general data and information are stored in the server log files. Collected may be: (1) browser types and versions used, (2) operating system used by the accessing system, (3) website from which an accessing system reaches our website (so-called referrers), (4) sub-sites, (5) date and time of access to the website, (6) Internet protocol address (IP address), (7) Internet service provider of the accessing system, and (8) other similar data and information that serve to protect against attacks on our information technology systems.

sections.title: 4. Contact Possibility via the Website
sections.content: The House of Europe Consulting website contains information that enables quick electronic contact with our company, which also includes a general email address (info@houseofeuropeconsulting.de). If a user contacts the data controller by email or through a contact form, the personal data transmitted are automatically stored. Such personal data transmitted voluntarily by a user to the controller are stored for the purpose of processing or contacting the user. There is no disclosure of this personal data to third parties.

sections.title: 5. Routine Erasure and Blocking of Personal Data
sections.content: The controller processes and stores personal data of the user only for the period necessary to achieve the purpose of storage or as provided for by European legislative and regulatory requirements. If the storage purpose ceases to apply or if a storage period prescribed by European legislation expires, the personal data are routinely blocked or erased in accordance with legal requirements.

sections.title: 6. Rights of the Data Subject
sections.content:
Each data subject has the following rights:

a) Right of confirmation
b) Right of access
c) Right to rectification
d) Right to erasure (Right to be forgotten)
e) Right to restriction of processing
f) Right to data portability
g) Right to object
h) Right to withdraw data protection consent

sections.title: 7. Cookies and Tracking
sections.content:
Our website uses cookies and similar tracking technologies to improve user experience and provide certain features. Cookies are text files stored on your computer that allow an analysis of your use of the website.

a) Types of Cookies
We use the following types of cookies:
- Technically necessary cookies: These are required for the operation of the website
- Analytics cookies: These help us understand and improve the use of our website
- Marketing cookies: These allow us to show relevant advertising

b) Cookie Control
You can configure your browser to:
- Be informed about the setting of cookies
- Allow cookies only in individual cases
- Exclude the acceptance of cookies for certain cases or in general
- Enable the automatic deletion of cookies when closing the browser

sections.title: 8. Provisions on the Use of Google Analytics
sections.content: This website uses Google Analytics, a web analytics service provided by Google Inc. Google Analytics uses cookies to help the website analyze how users use the site. The information generated by the cookie about your use of the website is usually transmitted to and stored by Google on servers in the United States. We use Google Analytics with IP anonymization enabled, which means your IP address will be truncated by Google within member states of the European Union or in other contracting states of the Agreement on the European Economic Area before transmission to the USA.

sections.title: 9. Provisions on the Use of YouTube
sections.content: Our website incorporates videos from YouTube, a video-sharing service by YouTube LLC. When you visit a page with embedded YouTube content, a connection is established with YouTube's servers, and the content is transmitted to your browser and displayed. As a result, usage data is transmitted to YouTube. We have no control over how YouTube uses this data.

sections.title: 10. Provisions on the Use of PayPal
sections.content: Our website integrates PayPal services as a payment option. PayPal is an online payment service provider. When you choose to pay via PayPal, your payment data is processed by PayPal. This includes information such as your name, address, email address, credit card details or bank information, and other data necessary to process the transaction.

sections.title: 11. Legal Basis for Processing
sections.content: Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR serves as the legal basis for processing operations where we obtain consent for a specific processing purpose. If the processing of personal data is necessary for the performance of a contract to which the data subject is party, the processing is based on Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR. The same applies to processing operations necessary for the implementation of pre-contractual measures.

sections.title: 12. Legitimate Interests in Processing
sections.content: Where the processing of personal data is based on Article 6(1)(f) GDPR, our legitimate interest is to conduct our business in favor of the well-being of all our employees and shareholders.

sections.title: 13. Storage Duration
sections.content: The criterion for determining the storage period of personal data is the respective statutory retention period. After the expiration of that period, the corresponding data is routinely deleted, as long as it is no longer necessary for the fulfillment or initiation of a contract.

sections.title: 14. Legal or Contractual Requirements
sections.content: We clarify that the provision of personal data is partly required by law (e.g., tax regulations) or can also result from contractual provisions (e.g., information on the contractual partner). Sometimes it may be necessary to conclude a contract that the data subject provides us with personal data, which must subsequently be processed by us.

sections.title: 15. Automated Decision-Making
sections.content: As a responsible company, we do not use automatic decision-making or profiling.

sections.title: 16. Changes to this Privacy Policy
sections.content: We reserve the right to modify this privacy policy at any time, so please review it frequently. Changes and clarifications will take effect immediately upon their posting on the website. If we make material changes to this policy, we will notify you here that it has been updated, so that you are aware of what information we collect, how we use it, and under what circumstances, if any, we use and/or disclose it.

items.question: How does the expansion process to Germany work?
items.answer: The process begins with a detailed analysis of your business, followed by personalized strategic planning. We assist in all stages, from legal company formation to business operationalization.

items.question: How long does it take to establish a company in Germany?
items.answer: The average timeframe is 2 to 3 months, considering all legal and bureaucratic procedures. This period may vary depending on the business complexity and required documentation.

items.question: What are the costs involved in expansion?
items.answer: Costs vary according to the type of company and project scope. We offer a free initial diagnosis to assess your needs and present a detailed budget.

items.question: Do you offer support after company formation?
items.answer: Yes, we offer continuous support in various areas such as accounting, HR, digital marketing, and business development to ensure the success of your operation.

items.question: How is market research conducted for my specific sector?
items.answer: Our market research is customized and includes detailed analysis of your sector, identification of direct and indirect competitors, study of local consumer behavior, and mapping of specific opportunities for your business.

items.question: How long does it take to get results from a complete market research?
items.answer: A complete market research usually takes 4 to 6 weeks, depending on the sector complexity and desired analysis depth. We also offer preliminary reports for more urgent decisions.

items.question: What types of visas can you help obtain?
items.answer: We assist with various types of visas, including visas for entrepreneurs, qualified professionals, researchers, students, and family reunion. Each case is evaluated individually to identify the best option.

items.question: What is the average timeframe for obtaining a work visa in Germany?
items.answer: The work visa process usually takes 2 to 4 months, including documentation preparation and embassy processing time. Specific cases may vary depending on complexity and visa type.

items.question: How does the professional mentoring program work?
items.answer: The mentoring program is personalized and includes regular individual sessions, career plan development, preparation for the German market, soft skills enhancement, and networking. The monitoring is continuous and adapted to your goals.

items.question: How soon can I expect results from professional mentoring?
items.answer: Initial results are usually noticed in 2-3 months, with significant improvements in professional positioning, networking, and local market understanding. The complete program can last from 6 months to 1 year.

items.question: How is the digital transformation strategy developed?
items.answer: We develop a personalized plan that begins with an assessment of your company's current digital maturity, identification of improvement opportunities, and gradual implementation of digital solutions, always aligned with your business objectives.

items.question: What tools and technologies do you use for digital transformation?
items.answer: We work with leading market technologies, including CRM systems, marketing automation tools, e-commerce platforms, data analysis solutions, and collaboration tools. The choice is based on each client's specific needs.

final.title: Ready to expand in Europe?
final.subtitle: Schedule a free consultation and discover how we can turn your vision into reality

terms.title: Terms of Use
terms.intro: Welcome to House of Europe Consulting's Terms of Use. Please read these terms carefully before using our services.

sections.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
sections.content: By accessing and using our website, you accept and agree to comply with these terms and conditions of use. If you disagree with any aspect of these terms, please do not use our website.

sections.title: 2. Services
sections.content: House of Europe Consulting offers consulting services for international expansion, digital transformation, and business development in Europe. Our services are customized according to each client's specific needs.

sections.title: 3. Intellectual Property
sections.content: All content on this website, including but not limited to text, graphics, logos, images, and software, is the property of House of Europe Consulting and is protected by copyright laws.

sections.title: 4. Limitation of Liability
sections.content: House of Europe Consulting shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, or consequential damages resulting from the use or inability to use our services.

cookies.title: Cookie Policy
cookies.intro: This policy explains how we use cookies and similar technologies on our website.

sections.title: 1. What are Cookies
sections.content: Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device when you visit our website. They help us provide a better user experience.

sections.title: 2. Types of Cookies We Use
sections.content: We use essential cookies for website functionality, analytical cookies to improve our services, and marketing cookies to personalize content.

sections.title: 3. How to Control Cookies
sections.content: You can control and/or delete cookies as you wish. You can delete all cookies that are already on your computer and set most browsers to prevent them from being placed.

sections.title: 4. Changes to this Policy
sections.content: We may update our cookie policy periodically. We recommend that you check this page regularly to stay informed about any changes.

items.quote: Â»A turning point that updated 100% of my way of thinking. Transformative and timely encounter. I can only thank and recommend. Amazing!!Â«
items.author: Carla Silva

items.quote: Â»Getting my residence permit in Germany and opening my company was a huge step in my life - and none of this would have been possible without you, Washington. You were with me in every detail, from preparing the Business Plan in German, through opening the company, to the visa process for my entire family. You transformed a complex process into something light and possible. Besides providing impeccable service, you transmit security and confidence, which makes all the difference. Immense gratitude! May more people be able to count on your talent!Â«
items.author: Eliseu Rocha

items.quote: Â»I am a businesswoman in the international trade fair sector in Germany and have hired Washington's services as a translator. He is a competent professional, and the clients were very satisfied with his work. Additionally, I used his services in the digital marketing area for my company and was also very satisfied with the results.Â«
items.author: Ludmila Buchetmann

items.quote: Â»Before the mentoring, I was completely lost about what to choose in school. It seemed like everyone else already knew what they wanted, only I didn't. During the mentoring, I took personality tests, we talked about what I like to do, what I'm good at... and everything started to make more sense. It was a relief to realize that I can choose subjects that fit me and my future. Now I feel much calmer and excited because I know I'm choosing a path that suits me. Honestly, it was an experience that helped me a lot! If you're also confused or don't know where to start, I highly recommend this mentoring. It made the difference for me.Â«
items.author: Rebecca
